title: nmap caveat is using wrong HOMEBREW_CELLAR prefix on M1

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew gist-logs <formula>` link OR `brew config` AND `brew doctor` output

```shell
$ brew gist-logs nmap
Error: No logs.

$ brew config
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.0.28-43-gdb4a95c
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: db4a95cfbcf472dbfa43b58ee00f53e0ab373215
Last commit: 5 hours ago
Core tap origin: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
Core tap HEAD: 6bbed3caa504890feeef0f656ae9b0a83cd2d4db
Core tap last commit: 4 months ago
Core tap branch: master
Core tap JSON: 11 Jul 23:46 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 10
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.10 => /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/2.6/usr/bin/ruby
CPU: 10-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 14.0.3 build 1403
Git: 2.41.0 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 7.88.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 13.4.1-arm64
CLT: 14.3.1.0.1.1683849156
Xcode: 14.3.1
Rosetta 2: false

$ brew doctor
Your system is ready to brew.
```


### Verification

- [X] My "`brew doctor` output" says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I ran `brew update` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I have resolved all warnings from `brew doctor` and that did not fix my problem.
- [X] I searched for recent similar issues at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues?q=is%3Aissue and found no duplicates.

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Installing nmap on apple M1 reports
```
==> Caveats
To use `ndiff`, you must do:
  chmod go-w /usr/local/Cellar
```


### What happened (include all command output)?

```
$ brew info nmap
==> nmap: stable 7.94 (bottled), HEAD
Port scanning utility for large networks
https://nmap.org/
Conflicts with:
  cern-ndiff (because both install `ndiff` binaries)
  ndiff (because both install `ndiff` binaries)
/opt/homebrew/Cellar/nmap/7.94_1 (830 files, 26.9MB) *
  Poured from bottle using the formulae.brew.sh API on 2023-07-11 at 15:19:02
From: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/HEAD/Formula/nmap.rb
License: Cannot Represent
==> Dependencies
Required: liblinear ✔, libssh2 ✔, lua ✔, openssl@3 ✔, pcre ✔
==> Options
--HEAD
	Install HEAD version
==> Caveats
To use `ndiff`, you must do:
  chmod go-w /usr/local/Cellar
==> Analytics
install: 0 (30 days), 0 (90 days), 0 (365 days)
install-on-request: 0 (30 days), 0 (90 days), 0 (365 days)
build-error: 29 (30 days)
```


### What did you expect to happen?

I would expect `/opt/homebrew/Cellar` or an unevaluated  `$(brew --prefix)/Cellar`. Seems `HOMEBREW_CELLAR` is already expanded in https://formulae.brew.sh/api/formula/nmap.json (never gets evaluated locally)

Also why does the formula require chmod change for the root folder `$HOMEBREW_CELLAR` ? - that doesn't seem right or at least why not just `Cellar/<formula>`? - which on my machine it is already `0755` . The change in https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/133176 didn't make this clear.




### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
`brew install nmap`
```
